oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sculpture of “The Flutist” at the Schermerhorn Symphony Center, Nashville, Tennessee, 2015 July 30
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of “The Flutist,” a marble sculpture by Márton Váró, dedicated to the memory of Kenneth D. Schermerhorn, music director and conductor of the Nashville Symphony from 1983 until his death in 2005. It is located with the garden along Fourth Avenue at the Schermerhorn Symphony Center, in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. The dimensions are approximately 3’ w X 8’ h. Forms part of the Leanne Garland Photograph Collection. 1 digital photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Váró, Márton
